body.p: Tennessee soldier and businessman. Married to Mary R. Miller. Father of Sarah Alice Miller Miller, Jennie Priscilla Miller Bowers, Kossuth D. Miller, and Rachel E. Miller. Served as Sheriff of Carter County, Tennessee in 1860. Served as colonel of the 13th Tennessee Cavalry of the Union Army from October 1863 to November 1865. Commanded the 3rd Brigade Cavalry Division of the Tennessee Governor’s Guard from April 1864 to November 1865. Court martialed in September 1865, which was disapproved by the President of the United States in January 1866, ordered reinstated and mustered out November 20, 1865.
